intro: Conostylis seorsiflora subsp. seorsiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to Australia, particularly found in the southern regions of Western Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils.
